description: In IT for 14 years. Latest 8 as Android Developer
summary:
In addition to Android I have also been working with another stack:
Backend - Ktor♥
DevOps - Docker♥, clouds, networks, PostgreSQL
Frontend - some experience with React & Bootstrap

fell_it.experience:
Outsourcing for clients from Europe. I usually work on several projects. Mostly I write apps for RGIS company which provides services for managing goods in a warehouse. My team usually has 2-3 developers. This is a proprietary apps that isn't distributed through google play

Client website
https://rgis.com

mobiblocks.experience:
I worked on the MyArea app. This is a startup and my hardest experience. App used for finding a business near your location and finding people by profession, with a messenger, calls, events, personal contacts and other features. I made it from scratch. Written in kotlin 100%. I was Android team lead, I had 2 developers in team

Application link:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=net.app.xmap

Web version:
https://myarea.com

fed_co.experience:
Outsourcing for the client from Europe. I develop cloud-based CMS for remote control of media content. This is a proprietary app that isn't distributed through google play

Client website
https://stino.com

it_pro_lab.experience:
Outsourcing for the client from USA. In this position I took part in the development of QMS (Quality Management Software) called MQ1 Elements. This is solution for the automation of large enterprises

Client website
https://qad.com

fincombank.experience: I started my career in a small bank. Working in a support & implementation team, I started to learn c# language. I developed several small utilities, also a program for the transfer payments from customers to the bank, which had a great success, for this I received the bonus and became the best employee of the year. Also I found a serious security vulnerability in the third-party software

college.name: College of Informatics in Chisinau
college.degree: Specialized education and Bachelor's, Information Technology

first.primary: Automatically publication of an app on Google Play
first.secondary: Publication about continuous integration in the case of TeamCity using java libs and Google Play Developer Console

second.secondary: My first publication - I wrote it in order to get an invitation to the habrahabr community, now it is a little outdated, then it was the latest c# 5.0 version

hobbies: Chess, CS:GO, belote, tennis, table tennis, movies, sleep
